issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description:
There are some inaccurate descriptions in help descriptions about PlanCommand and ExecuteCommand of DiskBalancer.
For example, in ExecuteCommand help description, "Execute command runs a submits a plan for execution on the given data node" should be modify
modified to "Execute command runs a submitted plan for execution on the given data node".
fields.summary: Modify help instructions of Plan command and Execute command about DiskBalancer

This message was automatically generated.
[~anu] Could you please help me with this commit? Some of the descriptions in log are not appropriate, may cause misunderstanding

[~steven-wugang] Thanks for tagging me and the contribution.  I will certainly review the patch. 

Just so that you know, usually we don't delete the old patches when we add new patches. The Jenkins job will automatically pickup the latest patch.  So for example, when you add patch 2, you can just leave the old patch in the Jira itself.

[~steven-wugang] Could you please post the output of the command from running with this change. It is difficult determine the output since it is mostly a format change. I would like to see how the new output looks. Thanks in advance
[~anu] sorry,I don't really know it.I'll follow the rule next time.Thank you for reminding me!

Not really a rule, just makes it easy to see what the changes are in each step of that patches. 
It is not an issue at all, just wanted to let you know that you don't have to delete the patch each time.
